required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-World Evaluation of the Effect of Jublia on Nail Polish
clinical_study.official_title: Real-World Evaluation of the Effect of Jublia on Nail Polish

brief_summary.textblock: A recent publication using cadaver nails suggests that Jublia application has a negative effect on nail polish texture.

detailed_description.textblock: It is believed that investigating the affect of Jublia is an important question with regards to how it affects how various nail polished and top coats will be used.

primary_outcome.measure: Observe Stability of Nail Polish as Evidenced by Serial Photography With Efinaconazole Application in Terms of Days
primary_outcome.description: Observation: Serial photographs were combined with patient reported outcomes to assess the stability of self-applied toenail polish when efinaconazole was applied topically to the nail. (Expected stability of polish less than 14 days with application of Jublia as compared to nails without Jublia application)

clinical_study.condition: Evaluation of Jublia on Nail Polish With Healthy Toenails

arm_group.description: One big toe will receive application of Efinaconazole Solution on top of nail polish (without the presence of a top coat or base coat)
Both big toes will use nail polish only

arm_group.arm_group_label: Base Coat + Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution
arm_group.description: One big toe will receive application of Efinaconazole solution on top of nail polish with base coat and top coat.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution
arm_group.description: One big toe will receive application of Efinaconazole solution on top of nail polish with top coat.

intervention.description: Application of Jublia to the nail of one big toe on top of the nail polish
Application of nail polish only to both big toe nails

intervention.intervention_name: Base Coat + Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution
intervention.description: Application of Jublia to the nail of one big toe on top of the nail polish with layers of top coat and base coat
intervention.arm_group_label: Base Coat + Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution

intervention.intervention_name: Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution
intervention.description: Application of Jublia to the nail of one big toe on top of the nail polish with layer of top coat
intervention.arm_group_label: Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Exhibit distal lateral subungual onychomycosis (DLSO)
- Has the informed consent been signed and patient's questions answered.
- Age â‰¥ 18
- Patient willing and able to participate for the full duration of the study
- No onychomycosis
- Greater than 4 weeks from prior major surgery for any indication
- Willing to abstain from:
- The application of other topical medications or cosmetic products to the toenail
- Professional pedicures for the duration of the study.
- Females of childbearing potential must:
- Have been using adequate contraception (abstinence, IUD, birth control pills or spermicidal gel with diaphragm or condom) since their last menses
- Agree to continue using adequate means of contraception (abstinence, IUD, birth control pills or spermicidal gel with diaphragm or condom) for the duration of study participation
- Females are not considered to be of childbearing potential if they are at least 1 year postmenopausal or have had a tubal ligation, bilateral oophorectomy or hysterectomy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active onychomycosis of the toenails or fingernails
- Any of the following in the 4 weeks (or as indicated) prior to randomization:
- Major surgery for any indication
- Any personal history of:
- Invasive cancer diagnosed or treated within the past 5 years. Participants who have been in remission for 5 years or more and have not required treatment in the past 5 years may be eligible if the principal investigator believes there is little to no risk of recurrence.
- Concurrent use of the following medications or treatments
- Other topical antifungals for any concomitant infection
- Females who are pregnant or lactating. Should a woman become pregnant or suspect she is pregnant while she is participating in this study she should notify the study physician immediately.
- Uncontrolled concurrent illness including ongoing or active infection, psychiatric illness or social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements or other underlying serious medical condition which, in the investigator's opinion, might preclude study participation.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each patient served as their own control. One big toenail received nail polish only and the other big toenail was treated with nail polish and efinaconazole solution.

group.title: Efinaconazole Solution and Nail Polish
group.description: Efinaconazole Solution and Nail Polish only (no base coat and no top coat) applied to great toenail

group.title: Nail Polish Only
group.description: No efinaconazole applied to one great toe. Only Nail per treatment arm

group.title: Efinaconazole Solution, Nail Polish, Top Coat, and Base Coat
group.description: One big toe will receive application of Efinaconazole solution on top of nail polish with base coat and top coat.

group.title: Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution
group.description: One big toe will receive application of Efinaconazole solution on top of nail polish with top coat.

baseline.population: Healthy adult with large toenail present

group.title: Jublia
group.description: Both big toes will receive application of toenail polish. One big toe will not use Jublia. Jublia: Application of Jublia to one big toenail Nail polish: Application of nail polish to both big toe nails Subjects had to be healthy and have a big toenail

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Observe Stability of Nail Polish as Evidenced by Serial Photography With Efinaconazole Application in Terms of Days
outcome.description: Observation: Serial photographs were combined with patient reported outcomes to assess the stability of self-applied toenail polish when efinaconazole was applied topically to the nail. (Expected stability of polish less than 14 days with application of Jublia as compared to nails without Jublia application)
outcome.population: Healthy adults with normal appearing big toenails applied toenail polish to both big toes. Jublia was applied to one big toe daily on top of the nail polish. Serial photography and participant report demonstrated the day until the nail polish degraded (became damaged). Control results were not analyzed.

group.title: Nail Polish and Efinaconazole Solution
group.description: Nail polish and Efinaconazole solution application (daily application of Efinaconazole solution)

group.title: Efinaconazole Solution, Nail Polish, and Top Coat
group.description: Efinaconazole solution applied daily to nail with top coat and nail polish

group.title: Placebo Comparator: Nail Polish Only
group.description: Both big toes will use nail polish only

group.title: Base Coat + Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution
group.description: Active Comparator: Base Coat + Nail Polish + Top Coat + Efinaconazole Solution One big toe will receive application of Efinaconazole solution on top of nail polish with base coat and top coat.

measure.title: Observe Stability of Nail Polish as Evidenced by Serial Photography With Efinaconazole Application in Terms of Days
measure.description: Observation: Serial photographs were combined with patient reported outcomes to assess the stability of self-applied toenail polish when efinaconazole was applied topically to the nail. (Expected stability of polish less than 14 days with application of Jublia as compared to nails without Jublia application)
measure.population: Healthy adults with normal appearing big toenails applied toenail polish to both big toes. Jublia was applied to one big toe daily on top of the nail polish. Serial photography and participant report demonstrated the day until the nail polish degraded (became damaged). Control results were not analyzed.

reported_events.time_frame: 50 nail application cycles, 14 days of jublia application.

group.title: Jublia
group.description: Both big toes will receive application of nail polish. . Only one big toe will use efinaconazole. Jublia: Application of Jublia to one big toes Nail polish: Application of nail polish to both big toe nails Subjects had to be healthy and have a big toenail

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Director of Clinical Trials, UAB Dermatology
